events.text:
Made by Viridino Studios (@ViridinoStudios)

Mateus Ferreira - Programmer
Twitter: @BonzerKitten
E-mail: ferreiramoreiramateus@gmail.com

Wesley Andrade - Artist
Twitter: @andrart7
E-mail: wesleymatos1989@gmail.com

Made with the support of patrons on https://www.patreon.com/viridinostudios
How far the player needs to move the analog stick before it starts to be recognized by the game.
The default screen refresh rate for testing.
How far or close the camera will be from the player.

children.text: Reset global variables to prevent traces from previous sessions.
Setup the player by adding its graphics to the collider as a child.
Receive and store input from the player to be used later in many situations.
Toggle input left.
Toggle input right.
Toggle input up.
Toggle input down.
Calculate the direction of both horizontal and vertical axis.
Also calculate the axis angle based on the horizontal and vertical axis, but only while the player is moving.
Move the player horizontally based on its horizontal axis.
Simulate player jump.
Mirror the player graphics based on its horizontal axis.
Change the animation states depending on what the player is currently doing, but only if the platform behavior is enabled.
Walk animation.
Idle animation.
Jump animation.
Fall animation.
Spawn different types of dust particles depending on the player actions.
Walking dust.
Landing dust.
Jumping dust.
Setup the trigger position to match to platform top mechanism.
Setup the platform back by moving it to the bottom of the layer, so it's always behind the player.
Destroy the player object and create a giant white flash.
Setup the giant white flash and animate it to disappear after some time.
Interpolate the camera position to constantly track the player with smooth movement.

parameters.x: lerp(Self.X, PlayerCollision.X + CAMERAOFFSETX, CameraSpeed * TARGETFRAMERATE * dt)
parameters.y: lerp(Self.Y, PlayerCollision.Y + CAMERAOFFSETY, CameraSpeed * TARGETFRAMERATE * dt)

children.text: Create a screen shake effect to add more intensity to specific actions.
Smoothed version of the axis angle variable.
How fast the player can fly while in flight mode.
How long the player can stay in flight mode while it's actived.
If the player overlaps a magic feather and is not already flying, take flight.

actions.text: Disable the magic feather temporarily, using the flight duration time as the cooldown value.
Restrict the flight mode duration by using a timer.
Slowly accelerate by tweening the flight speed variable.
Store the last X and Y position of the player, so it doesn't start the trail in a different place.

children.text: Apply the previously defined value to the flight speed variable.
When the player is not flying, store the raw axis angle in the lerped angle variable.
But if the player is actually flying, store a lerped version of the axis angle, so movement is smoother overall.

actions.text: Use the lerped angle and the flight speed variables to move the player forward.

children.text: Leave a trail behind the player while in flight mode, by using layer effects to create line pattern mask.

actions.text: Move trail mask to the bottom of the layer.
Adjust the trail mask angle to point towards the player.
Adjust the trail width to reach the player last position.

children.text: If the player collides with a wall while in flight mode, disable the flight mode and request the necessary effects.
If the flight mode ends before the player is able to hit a wall, disable the flight mode and request the necessary effects.
Switch to the flight mode, by disabling the platform behavior and enabling the 8 direction behavior.

actions.text: Reset both vectors and disable the platform behavior.
Reset both vectors and enable the 8 direction behavior.
Also change the player animation to the fly animation.

children.text: Disable the flight mode, by disabling the 8 direction behavior and enabling the platform behavior.

actions.text: Reset both vectors and disable the 8 direction behavior.
Reset both vectors and enable the platform behavior.
Slowly start to fall by tweening the gravity value.

children.text: Apply the previously defined value to the gravity parameter.
Spawn a few sparks with random speed and angle values, to create a more dynamic effect.
Destroy the spark object after its animation is done to prevent any kind of CPU and memory overload.
Spawn a big flash and a few small explosions to create a very impactful effect.
Destroy the small explosion object after its animation is done to prevent any kind of CPU and memory overload.
Destroy the big flash object after its animation is done to prevent any kind of CPU and memory overload.
Re-enable the magic feather after its cooldown is over.
Restart the game.
Restart the game.
Close the game.
